name: Dark Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and attach that Energy card to it.

flavorText: The number of incidents of hackers using Magnetons to damage computer systems is steadily increasing.

strengths: Magnetic Lines disrupts opponent's energy placement
Colorless cost on Sonicboom means flexibility
Can strand energy on weak benched Pokemon
weaknesses: Fighting weakness is devastating vs Hitmonchan
Magnetic Lines requires opponent to have bench
synergies: Gust of Wind (bring up energy-starved Pokemon)

competitiveHistory: Dark Magneton was an interesting disruption card. Magnetic Lines could mess with the opponent's energy distribution, potentially stranding energy on Benched Pokemon they didn't want to use. However, the 60 HP and Fighting weakness made it vulnerable to the ubiquitous Hitmonchan, limiting its competitive impact.

rulings.ruling: Magnetic Lines only works if the Defending Pokemon has basic Energy attached AND the opponent has Benched Pokemon.
You choose which basic Energy to move and which Benched Pokemon receives it.
Special Energy cards like Double Colorless Energy cannot be moved by Magnetic Lines.
